questions.text: Which of the following is considered an early pioneer who brought attention to the phenomenon of hypnosis?
questions.explanation:
Franz Anton Mesmer.

	Mesmer was a bit of a P.T. Barnum. Moreover, he didn't really understand what he had 'discovered'. He was investigated by some prominent men of his time - but never established his theories with prominence and acceptance in the scientific community. The term 'mesmerism' derives from him.

questions.text: The explanation for hypnosis that was offered by the pioneer who gave his name to a term for hypnotism was based on ...?
questions.explanation:
Animal Magnetism.

	Magnetic forces played an important part in Mesmer's theory. He was wrong.

James Braid.

	The others were prominent men of their time who were interested in - and familiar with - hypnosis.

questions.text: The term 'hypnosis' derives from the Greek word for ....?
questions.explanation:
Sleep.

	People under hypnosis appeared to be in a sleeplike state.

All of these.

	It is used as a relaxation technique, but it also has been used to block pain and to delve into unconscious memories.

questions.text: A post-hypnotic suggestion is significant for which of the following reasons?
questions.correct: It may operate after the hypnotic state has ended
options: The subject is consciously aware of the suggestion
It is given after the subject has already awakened from the hypnotic state
questions.explanation:
It may operate after the hypnotic state has ended.

	The suggestion is given while the individual is hypnotized, but it operates after the person has awakened from the hypnotic state.

questions.text: Which of the following is a fictional work that employed hypnosis?
questions.explanation:
'Trilby'.

	The tale included the evil hypnotist, Svengali. 'Prophet' is about Edgar Cayce. 'Lodger' is about 'Jack the Ripper'. 'Freedom' is a fictional work about an Amelia Earhart type character.

questions.text: One of the remarkable traits of certain hypnotic subjects is their ability to speak in unknown or foreign languages. This is known as ...?
A prominent case involving age regression and 'awareness of a past life involved what person?
questions.explanation:
Bridey Murphy.

	A fellow named Morey Bernstien wrote a book, 'The Search for Bridey Murphy', in which he claimed to have hypnotically regressed a housewife back a few centuries.

questions.text: Some theorists argue that a 'direct suggestion' given to a hypnotic subject may cause problems due to ...?
questions.explanation:
Symptom Substitution.

	The theory says that if the symptom being treated is only a manifestation of the problem (rather than the problem itself). Thus, eliminating the symptom only will cause a new symptom to arise, since the underlying problem is still intact.
